text: you can past html code in the wysiwyg text editor, just click the source button… ?

Let’s say I’m using `export_to_template_context` for something in a blog post template and I want to access the value of that in a blog listing module, is it possible? So basically, attach some data to each blog post through an `export_to_template_context`  tag and be able to access it when looping through `contents`?
Pretty sure it comes through widget_data
Yeah, that’s what I thought, but `content.widget_data|tojson` is showing `""` and `content.widgets` is showing `{}`
Pretty sure you have to actually set it in the post though. It won't pick up defaults
I know I've used it. I'll check when I get into the office if you haven't figured it out by then

Like, I have `{% text "external_post_link", label="External Post Link", value="", export_to_template_context=True %}` in blog-post.html, and I have a blog listing module in blog-index.html, and I need to access that value when looping through `{% for content in contents %}` . This is because a lot of their “blog posts” are supposed to redirect to an external link instead of going to the internal post.
Oooh. I think I see what the issue is.

Hi all,
I'm trying to use a (HubSpot) form on a (HubSpot) landing page with a custom domain. (say <http://x.mydomain.com|x.mydomain.com> )
However, the form on the landing page posts to a different domain than the landing page itself. (<http://forms.hsforms.com|forms.hsforms.com>)
Due to restrictions for our audience, I'm probably be able to whitelist our landing page domain (<http://x.mydomain.com|x.mydomain.com>) but not the HubSpot domain (<http://forms.hsforms.com|forms.hsforms.com>, which would also be a maintenance burden/hazard)
Is there anything I can do to make the form post within the original domain?
Yeah, stupid mistake, I was looking at ones I didn’t have any external link set on. :laughing:
